channel.title: podcasts – First Time Flowing
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: This American Lab
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I’ve been listening to Radio Lab and This American Life (available in podcast and radio flavors) and I’ve decided that they are the gold standard when measuring what a slice of life, short form documentary program ought to be. Beyond just superb sound design, the shows are edifying in a way that makes me feel […]
item.content:encoded: I’ve been listening to Radio Lab and This American Life (available in podcast and radio flavors) and I’ve decided that they are the gold standard when measuring what a slice of life, short form documentary program ought to be. Beyond just superb sound design, the shows are edifying in a way that makes me feel better about the world in general. Also, if Ira Glass and Jad Abumrad interviewed each other, my mind would explode.

item.title: Retrogasmic 1.3 – My Primitive Ancestry
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: My latest article is up at Secure Immaturity. It is on early, pre-graphic games and their modern descendants. I’ve closed comments here to encourage responses at the Secure Immaturity site.
item.content:encoded:
My latest article is up at Secure Immaturity. It is on early, pre-graphic games and their modern descendants.

I’ve closed comments here to encourage responses at the Secure Immaturity site.

item.title: Judge John Hodgman
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: The other night, Nick and I had the opportunity to be on one of our favorite podcasts, Jordan, Jesse GO! They have an occasional segment with John Hodgman (The Daily Show, “PC” in the Mac commercials, Neil Gaiman’s Coraline, etc.) where people present complaints and he issues a judgment. Nick has been goading me to […]
item.content:encoded:
The other night, Nick and I had the opportunity to be on one of our favorite podcasts, Jordan, Jesse GO! They have an occasional segment with John Hodgman (The Daily Show, “PC” in the Mac commercials, Neil Gaiman’s Coraline, etc.) where people present complaints and he issues a judgment.

Nick has been goading me to grow a gigantic beard and I have refused, so he called up the show and requested for Judge Hodgman to resolve it.

Here is a link to the show. Our bit starts at around 21:30. The show is saturated with profanity, in case that bothers you, though our segment is pretty clean.

LINK

item.title: Joss on GeeksOn
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I have to give props to my homies at the GeeksOn podcast for scoring a guest appearance by Joss Whedon. Have a listen here. Then come check out their forums. You may even see me there. ðŸ˜‰
item.content:encoded:
I have to give props to my homies at the GeeksOn podcast for scoring a guest appearance by Joss Whedon.

Have a listen here.

Then come check out their forums. You may even see me there.

item.title: GeeksOn
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: Today is my one year anniversary of being on the GeeksOn forums, the one and only forum I participate in. Yay!
item.content:encoded:
Today is my one year anniversary of being on the GeeksOn forums, the one and only forum I participate in.

Yay!
